data.value: Security

data.value: Extras

data.value: Finished

data.name: Step1_Intro
data.value: Thank for you downloading Roadkill .NET Wiki engine. The installer writes the settings you enter here to the web.config file (and also the database).

data.name: Step1_WebConfig_Intro
data.value: In order to proceed, first we need to test if you have write access to the web.config file.

data.name: Step1_WebConfig_Success_Message
data.value: The web.config can be written to.

data.name: Step1_WebConfig_Failure_Message
data.value: Unable to write to the web.config file.

data.name: Step2_Intro
data.value: Below are some required settings for Roadkill to work correctly. You can change these later via the settings page as an admin.

data.name: Step2_ConnectionString_CreateDatabase
data.value: Note: you will need to create the database first.

data.name: Step2_Example_ConnectionStrings
data.value: Example connection strings

data.name: Step2_SQLiteInstructionsTitle
data.value: SQLite: please read

data.name: Step2_SQLiteInstructionsMessage
data.value: Note: to use SQLite you need to add another file to the /bin folder, as SQLite is distributed for both x86 and x64. {BEGIN-SQLITE_LINK}Click here to copy the file{END-SQLITE_LINK}. If you experience any issues after this, delete "SQLite.Interop.dll" from your bin folder.

data.name: Step2_SQLiteSuccessTitle
data.value: SQLite file copy success

data.name: Step2_SQLiteSuccessMessage
data.value: SQLite should now be ready to use.

data.name: Step2_SQLiteFailureTitle
data.value: SQLite file copy failed

data.name: Step2_SQLiteFailureMessage
data.value: Failure - try copying the SQLite.Interop.dll file from ~/App_Data/SQLiteBinaries to your bin folder.

data.name: Step3_Use_WindowsAuth_Intro
data.value: Do you want to users to be authenticated against an Active Directory using Windows authentication?

data.name: Step3_AD_ConnectionString_Title
data.value: Active Directory LDAP connection string

data.name: Step3_AD_Connection_Success
data.value: The connection and authentication with the Active Directory server was successful.

data.name: Step3_AD_Connection_Error
data.value: Unable to connect to the Active Directory server:

data.name: Step3_AD_Success
data.value: The group was queried sucessfully.

data.name: Step3_AD_Error
data.value: Unable to query:

data.name: Step3_AD_ConnectionString_Details
data.value: This should be in the format LDAP://mydc01.company.internal (it should be uppercase LDAP) where mydc01 is your domain controller and 'company' and 'internal' are the dns suffixes for your network. This can also be an IP address. You can usually get this information by running "ipconfig".

data.name: Step3_AD_ADExplorer_Details
data.value: The connection string supports OU specifiers however doing it this way can cause issues. If you are unsure about this setting, it's recommended you download {BEGIN_ADEXPLORER_LINK}AD Explorer{END_ADEXPLORER_LINK} first.

data.name: Step3_AD_Username_Password_Details
data.value: Enter a username and password if the user that the app pool is running under does not have read access to Active Directory. This is useful if your Active Directory domain is a separate forest from the main domain (i.e. another branch office).

data.name: Step3_AD_Editor_GroupName_Title
data.value: Editor group name

data.name: Step3_AD_Editor_GroupName_Details
data.value: This is the security group that users should belong to in order to be editors (people who can edit and create pages). The test button uses the connection settings entered above.

data.name: Step3_AD_Admin_GroupName_Title
data.value: Admin group name

data.name: Step3_AD_Admin_GroupName_Details
data.value: This is the security group that users should belong to in order to be admins. Admins have the same rights as editors, but also have access to configuration settings and tools for the site.The test button uses the connection settings entered above.

data.name: Step3_One_Way_Hashed
data.value: All passwords are one-way encrypted using SHA128 and a salt. This means passwords are not recoverable and will require an admin to reset them (there is no reset password functionality yet). The minimum password length is 6 characters.

data.name: Step3_DB_Editor_Role_Title
data.value: Editor role name

data.name: Step3_DB_Editor_Role
data.value: This is the name of the editor role - people who can edit and create pages.

data.name: Step3_DB_Admin_Role_Title
data.value: Admin role name

data.name: Step3_DB_Admin_Role
data.value: This is the name of the admin role. Admins have the same rights as editors, but also have access to configuration settings and tools for the site.

data.name: Step3_DB_Allow_User_Signups_Title
data.value: Allow user signups

data.name: Step3_DB_Allow_User_Signups
data.value: Check this option if you want to allow people to signup as a new users. If left unchecked, only admins will be able to create new users.

data.name: Step3_DB_Allow_User_Signups_Label
data.value: Allow new user signups.

data.name: Step3_DB_Enable_Recaptcha_Description
data.value: If you are allowing user signups, it's recommended that you also enable Recaptcha support. This is a free anti-spam bot service provided by Google, you will need to signup and copy your public and private key into the fields below. {BEGIN_RECAPTCHA_LINK}Signup here{END_RECAPTCHA_LINK} - you will need to create a google account first.

data.name: Step3_DB_Admin_Email_Title
data.value: Admin email

data.name: Step3_DB_Admin_Email
data.value: This is the email address for the admin user. You can add more admins in the settings page, so this user does not 'own' the site

data.name: Step3_DB_Admin_Password_Title
data.value: Admin password

data.name: Step3_DB_Admin_Password
data.value: This is the password for the admin user.

data.name: Step4_Almost_Done
data.value: Almost done...Finally some extra tweakable settings.

data.name: Step4_Attachments_Folder_Description
data.value: This is the directory where all files are uploaded to. This directory will need write permission by the user that the app pool runs under. Most of the time you shouldn't have to worry about changing the permissions for the folder, as they will be inherited from the parent folder.

data.name: Step4_Attachments_Folder_RelativePath
data.value: The folder path should start with "~/" for the website root, or be a file path (e.g. c:\myattachments).

data.name: Step5_Success_Title
data.value: Installation successful

data.name: Step5_WindowsAuth_Please_Read
data.value: Windows Authentication - please read

data.name: Step5_WindowsAuth_IIS_Settings
data.value: If you are using IIS7+ you may need to configure the web.config file for your security setup, below are the elements that are required.If you receive 500 errors after making these changes, then the section is locked at a parent level, and you will need to make the changes via the IIS manager.

data.name: Step5_Continue_Button
data.value: Continue to the site

data.name: Step5_Failure_Title
data.value: An error occurred during the install

data.name: Step5_Failure_GoBack_And_Check
data.value: Please go back through the installation steps and check your settings. The error message was:
